content: Special Arrangements for candidates with visual difficulties

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td p span
content: Visual difficulties may range from a minor condition to total blindness, and Cambridge ESOL can supply enlarged and

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td p a span
html body text div table tbody tr td p span
content: for less serious difficulties, or brailled and modified question papers where these are required.

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td p span
html body text div table tbody tr td p span
content: If you have visual difficulties, you can ask for Special Arrangements to be made so that you can take the following exams:

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td ul li span
html body text div table tbody tr td ul li span
html body text div table tbody tr td ul li span
html body text div table tbody tr td ul li span
html body text div table tbody tr td ul li span
html body text div table tbody tr td ul li span
html body text div table tbody tr td ul li span
html body text div table tbody tr td ul li span
html body text div table tbody tr td ul li span
html body text div table tbody tr td ul li span
content: Certificates in ESOL Skills for Life

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td p span
content: Applications for Special Arrangements for other ESOL examinations not listed above may be possible.

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td p span
content: How to apply for Special Arrangements

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td p span
html body text div table tbody tr td p a span
html body text div table tbody tr td p span
content: as soon as possible. In the case of IELTS you must

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td p a span
html body text div table tbody tr td p span
html body text div table tbody tr td p span
content: Please check the latest dates for application which vary according to the exam and are usually several months before the exam. Your centre will tell you when you must apply.

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td p span
content: The centre will ask for full details of your particular visual difficulty, and make all the necessary special arrangements for you to take the exam.

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td p span
content: You may be asked to provide a medical certificate.

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td p span
content: Please read through the following sections carefully, and make sure that you ask for all the necessary arrangements to be made.

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td p span
content: See also the Important notes section below.

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td p span
content: What Special Arrangements you can request

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td p span
html body text div table tbody tr td p span
content: If you have visual difficulties, you will almost certainly need extra time to complete a paper. You may ask for an extra 25% of the normal time allowed for a paper.

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td p span
content: You may ask for more than 25% extra time. This might be necessary if, for example, it takes you a long time to read the questions or record your answers.

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td p span
content: Remember, however, that too much extra time may make you very tired.

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td p span
content: You will also be allowed to have breaks whilst taking a paper, in addition to any extra time you need. Ask your centre to tell you what you will be allowed.

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td p span
content: 2. Reading the question papers in a different way

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td p span
content: If you are partially sighted you may use the following equipment:

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td ul li span
html body text div table tbody tr td ul li span
html body text div table tbody tr td ul li span
html body text div table tbody tr td p span
content: You may ask a 'reader' to read and re-read questions to you (but see the Important notes section below).

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td p span
content: 3. Writing your answers in a different way

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td p span
content: If you wish, you may record your answers in the following ways:

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td ul li span
content: you may use your Braille machine

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td ul li span
content: you may use your Braille machine, linked to a printer

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td ul li span
content: you may use a typewriter or word-processor. If you want to use a word-processor, it must not have a spellcheck or thesaurus facility

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td ul li span
content: you may dictate your answers to an amanuensis (see the Important notes section below).

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td p span
html body text div table tbody tr td p span
content: Braille versions of KET, PET, FCE, CAE, CPE, BEC, CELS and IELTS (certain papers only) can normally be made available.

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td p span
content: Please tell us whether you need your papers in contracted or uncontracted Braille.

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td p span
html body text div table tbody tr td ul li span
content: the supervisor will also have a print version of each Braille paper

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td ul li span
content: in some papers we arrange for the texts and the questions to be brailled in separate booklets.

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td p span
content: We can send you past exam papers in Braille as practice material. Please ask us in good time, if you would like us to send you some past papers. Contact the ESOL Special Circumstances Unit (see the Further information section below).

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td p span
html body text div table tbody tr td p span
content: You can ask for two different kinds of enlarged question paper.

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td p span
html body text div table tbody tr td p span
content: We enlarge the standard question paper making no changes to the layout or material. You will receive A3 size question papers.

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td p span span
html body text div table tbody tr td p span
html body text div table tbody tr td p span
content: We change the question papers, removing 'visual' material which is not essential for answering the question. We then make large-print versions of the papers in A4 size.

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td p span span
html body text div table tbody tr td p span
content: Note that we can also supply reduced print question papers.

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td p span
html body text div table tbody tr td p span
content: We make special arrangements for these tests.

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td p span
content: Many of the questions in the listening tests ask candidates to make notes while they listen to a tape. If you are blind or have visual difficulties you may not be able to do this.

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td p span
content: We produce a special version of the listening test.

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td p span
content: You will hear the same material and answer the same questions as other candidates.

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td p span
html body text div table tbody tr td ul li span
content: stop the tape before each part of the test to allow you enough time to read the questions

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td ul li span
content: stop the tape at certain points during each part to allow you enough time to write one or more answers

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td ul li span
content: stop the tape after each part to allow you enough time to check your answers.

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td p span
content: You should note that when the tape is paused during a part, you:

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td ul li span
content: may not need to write an answer at all.

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td ul li span
content: may need to write more than one answer.

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td p span
html body text div table tbody tr td p span
content: For KET, PET, FCE, CAE, BEC or CELS, you must normally take the speaking test with a partner.

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td p span
content: If you have visual difficulties, you can apply to:

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td ul li span
content: have extra time if it takes you longer than usual to read any exam material or decide what you want to say

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td ul li span
content: take the test with a partner who is not taking the examination

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td ul li span
content: take the test without a partner (i.e. in the parts of the test which usually ask both candidates to talk to each other, you talk to the examiner instead). (Please note that this option is not available for BEC or CELS.)

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td ul li span
html body text div table tbody tr td p span
content: Parts of the speaking test for some exams are visual - they use pictures taken from newspapers or magazines, for example.

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td p span
content: If you are partially sighted we can supply enlarged copies of these pictures. If you find it difficult to use enlarged pictures we can supply enlarged print versions of written descriptions of the photographs. Talk to your centre about which would be best for you.

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td p span
content: We can also supply material in Braille for blind candidates.

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td p span
content: For example, in the Braille version of the FCE Speaking Test:

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td ul li span
content: the examiner will spend a few minutes asking you to talk about yourself

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td ul li span
content: you will then be given short written descriptions of two photographs in Braille. The examiner will ask you to compare and contrast the situations in the descriptions and give your opinion about them. You will have about a minute to do this

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td ul li span
content: finally you will be asked to take part in various conversational activities using brailled notes or information.

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td p span
html body text div table tbody tr td p span
content: A reader is a person who will read the questions out to you. Note that the reader will not explain the questions to you or offer any advice. A reader is not usually allowed to read out the texts in a Reading Test.

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td p span
content: An amanuensis is a person who will write down your answers. If you would like an amanuensis to write down your answers, you should note that:

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td ul li span
content: you will be asked to spell certain words

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td ul li span
html body text div table tbody tr td p span
content: The amanuensis will also read your answers back to you if you wish.

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td p span
content: Please contact your centre if you would like to know more about having a reader or an amanuensis.

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td p span
content: We recommend that you practise with a reader/amanuensis before the examination. For example, you should make sure that you can spell out the letters of the alphabet.

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td p span
html body text div table tbody tr td ol li span
content: Please note that it may not always be possible for a Braille version of a particular examination to be prepared.

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td ol li span
content: British Standard Braille is moving over towards the optional use of capital letters. Skills for Life Level 1 & 2 Reading may specifically test the use of capitals. Capitals will therefore be included in Braille versions of Skills for Life Reading in those tasks which test their use, and candidates who are preparing to take a Braille version of Skills for Life should be made aware of this. Capitals will not be included in texts or questions for other tasks for the time being.

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td ol li span
content: Cambridge ESOL reserves the right not to approve applications for Special Arrangements. No application will be considered unless it has the unreserved support of the centre.

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td p span
html body text div table tbody tr td p span
content: If you would like information or advice, please first

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td p a span
html body text div table tbody tr td p span
html body text div table tbody tr td p span
content: For further information or advice about Special Arrangements contact:
